website_summaries.verdict: An affordable earbud option that delivers the same high-quality sound Sennheiser is known for.
pros: A good variety of ear tips to fit different size ears
Decent sound for an earbud design
cons: Better earbud options are available for people who want high-quality sound in a small package

customer_reviews.title: WARNING!!! It's a Counterfeit!
customer_reviews.text: Over the years, I've owned multiple Sennheiser products, and they have all been quality pieces of equipment. As soon as I opened the box, I knew that this wasn't authentic Sennheiser. It looked and felt cheap, the logo wasn't right, the plug wasn't right, and the way that the wiring was assembled made the earbuds almost unusable. When I examined the packaging, I found that Sennheiser's QR label and authenticating holographic sticker were absent. The final nail was going to the Sennheiser website to discover that there is no such model as the CX 300 II. The current model is the CX 300.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Reinschreiber

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, but a poorly-constructed product
customer_reviews.text: While the sound coming from the buds is what I expect from a Sennheiser product, the overall construction is horrible. The plug connecting the earbuds to my phone recently started coming apart. Now, I am not hard on my earbuds. I'm not a runner, so these are not being bounced up and down or undergoing any kind of rough usage. I mostly use these during my commute to/from work and to listen to music while at my desk. After just over one month of usage (purchased these on July 3), I'm now having to buy yet another pair of earbuds. They will not be Sennheisers.
customer_reviews.author: A. V. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Underrated earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Big fan of Sennheiser products. I think the company builds a quality product at an reasonable price, much better than some brands that are heavily marketed. These are my third pair due to always traveling with them, but then forgetting that I left them in the front seat pocket on the plane...so there are a couple folks out there enjoying these earbuds for free. Great sound quality, clear concise highs, solid bass without being too "boomy", and although not electric noise canceling, the earbuds fit nicely in the ear to insulate from outside noise considerably. If I ever lose another set of these, I would purchase again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: ChubB

customer_reviews.title: excellent sound quality but weak in fitting
customer_reviews.text: the sound quality is excellent, v. high on price to quality. however, weak in fitting. the cable feels weak, low quality. the length of the left cable is about half of the right cable making fitting difficult and unstable when used for outdoor activities. the earbud design does not provide a secured fit into the ear. getting loose easily during workout. this is a low budget but high quality sound earbud for home use, not very ideal for outdoor. overall a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Best quality audio at this price point you're going to find!
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed with these ear buds. I own several high end sets of ear buds that cost well over $200. I bought these based upon the "Sennheiser" name. I wanted some good quality ear buds I could use outdoors without worry of losing or damaging while working. Have had these for almost a month now and for the price, the quality can't be beat. The price-to-audio quality in these is more in line with a $70 to $100 set of buds. I mostly listen to classic rock on my iPod while working. They block out a decent amount of background noise, as well. For the price, you're not going to beat these ear buds!
customer_reviews.author: Ribs & Blues

customer_reviews.title: Terrible design, mediocre audio performance.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible design and cables. Bass is not as strong as expected, audio is not clear at all. The worse part is that the left right earpiece cables are of severely different lengths. Why would anyone do that? To add to that, the cables are very curly and messy, which makes wearing this in public a total embarrassment. I expected better from Sennheiser. A very lousy product from a supposedly reputable brand.
customer_reviews.author: Author

customer_reviews.title: Die Young.  Stay Pretty.
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds have excellent sound...while it lasts. I keep buying them, and they keep shorting out. Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice (or more), shame on me. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: An American Abroad

customer_reviews.title: These are counterfeit
customer_reviews.text: Everything felt odd about them - the package, the cord and the plug. And then the kicker is that the cords are not the same length! If you have owned the real thing you will know. This is appalling that they charge $20 for something that should be in the Dollar Store. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Crushes gifting

customer_reviews.title: I abused these headphones pretty bad
customer_reviews.text: sound quality is alright, but what I loved most about these headphones is that they are build to last they look simple and breakable, but I sweat with these, I drop them in the floor. I put them in the clothes washer. I left them in my car in texas head over 110. I even pulled them, but not break them of course, I also drop them multiple times. Now I have lost them, but I'm sure wherever they are. They still work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Extremely high pitch, hard on your ears.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if I got a faulty pair or what, but it's so high pitch that it is really uncomfortable to listen to music with them. It's pure high tones and the mid range and bass are non existent. Not sure what the deal is with it. I would NOT recommend them, they are so painful on my ears that I used them maybe 3 times.
customer_reviews.author: Aorata

customer_reviews.title: My Daily Driver For Years
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these (or very similar models) for almost 10 years. They're the best ear buds in terms of sound quality, noise isolation, and bass. They come with a tiny carrying case that is actually easy to use instead of the kind you wind around something and end up hating to untangle. These are cheap so if you accidentally destroy them, just grab another pair of whatever the newest version of these is.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: Lasted seven (7) years
customer_reviews.text: The plug has gotten a little worn out so i went on amazon to replace these. I searched my order history because I knew I wanted the same exact ones. I bought these in 2010!!!! It is now 2017. Money extremely well spent. I used these heavily for four years and stuff them in my backpack now in a very haphazard manner.
customer_reviews.author: A. T.

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Value, Quality Earbuds, Horrid Packaging
customer_reviews.text: After borrowing the jaws of life from the local fire company to get the package open ... seriously the packaging is a little over-the-top BUT once out of the package these earbuds are top-shelf. The fit is comfortable but snug, the highs and mid-tones are crisp and clear, the bass is surprisingly solid for a pair of earbuds, and overall they are well worth the investment. I also like the design where the connecting cord is a bit heavier and leads to the left ear and then a slightly lighter cord lays comfortably behind your head to connect to the right ear. Bottom line is I am exceptionally pleased and I recommend these earbuds without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Dougherty

customer_reviews.title: Decent for $30
customer_reviews.text: These days it's worth spending the extra money to have the speaker on the earbuds to take calls. This is a little inconvenient and that's my biggest complaint. I have the Sennheiser CX300s model as well and the build quality is much better. It's just $20 more, but I'd recommend spending the extra to be able to answer phone calls. Wire seems a little thin, but for $30 the sound quality is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Nakamura

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound. Comfortable fit. Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set of Sennheiser CX300s. I had the first set for years loving every moment I spent listening to music with them. I killed them testing an amplifier I was building. They literally went up in smoke. The CX 300s have excellent audio quality and reproduce all frequencies admirably. What I have always enjoyed is how richly they cover low frequencies for such a small package. I also like their fit and comfort even after wearing for extended periods.
customer_reviews.author: Rick S.

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but I'd recommend something else.
customer_reviews.text: These lasted me about three and a half years. I really didn't have any complaints except that one side is longer than the other which is annoying. The sound wasn't incredible. I would prefer to have better sound, but you get what you pay for. After about three and a half years one side went mute, no sound, so I had to replace it. The replacement buds I got cost about ten bucks less, but they have a much much better sound. I'm glad these things died.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Never can go wrong with Sennheiser.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these almost a decade ago. Still work like they are brand new. I mountain bike with these and have been doing that since I owned them. I've had them yanked out of my ears from branches, dropped them in mud and water. Never a problem. If you get anything besides these for the price your're doing it wrong. 10 years of service and still going strong. Sound quality for earbuds is impressive and they have bass.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan poeppel

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser Bassbetont
customer_reviews.text: Great quality sound.. my first impression was that it haves more treble than bass but after changing the ear adaptors from the middle to the greatest it had a great difference and sounds much better.. a great noise isolation that let you capture every sound on the music, i think is similar to my 3M Littmann Stethoscope in that.. I had before a Sennheiser LD101 with great sound if you were alone at night in a room, but during the day at traffic they had no good noise isolation.. this one has! The bass is really good if you put the right adaptors in a right position into your ears, a nice surround sound..
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Gluten

customer_reviews.title: Apparently not what they used to be
customer_reviews.text: I have been purchasing these exact Sennheiser earphones for years because I found that the sound quality for price was unrivaled, especially for bass. However, this particular set arrived and the wires were noticeably thinner than my older ones, the sound was already crackling like my older used ones, and the mesh inside one of the buds was completely loose and could fall right out so I am too afraid to use them lying down in case it falls into my ear or something before I can repair it. I needed the headphones urgently for work so I opted not to return them, but disappointed in decline in quality from previous sets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sennheisers have always been my go-to brand for headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I loved these headphones when I had them, Sennheiser has always been the brand that I look to when I'm trying to purchase good sounding headphones at a SUPER reasonable price. From their HD201's / HD202's I don't think I've EVER found better headphones for the money. Their sound quality is top notch, and the build quality is impeccible. The only reason I don't still have the Sennheisers that I use to own is because I've either misplaced them or given them to friends and family, of whom are all also loving them. If you were to get any headphones at this price range, make it THESE headphones.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Not durable at all
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered two pairs of these headphones. The sound that comes out of them is great, however the durability is not up to par. Both sets of headphones have had one earbud stop working within a year of having them. I believe a wire comes loose somewhere they connect. Contacting senheisser warranty is a pain and I have yet to get ahold of anyone. If they were more durable I would give these 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: AJ B.

customer_reviews.title: Headphones are setup so the right side goes behind your head which I'm not sure if I like as much
customer_reviews.text: Bought these after really loving the CX300 (not the II). Not a fan of how the jack the 1/8" is huge compared to the older version. Headphones are setup so the right side goes behind your head which I'm not sure if I like as much. Wasn't expecting that many changes from the second version of a product. That being said audio quality is really good. Not a true noise isolation (IE doesn't need power to work) but if you have music playing really hard to hear the outside world.
customer_reviews.author: alex kasper

customer_reviews.title: Not bad!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE 6/19/19: left/right ear bud (can’t remember) lost sound within 2 weeks of use from it arriving at my door. —•— Great earbuds for the price! They sound 30 dollars to me, with a fair amount of bass and clear vocals. Beats Sony's MDRXB50AP/B any day (I owned a pair of them and I wasn't satisfied one bit). The significantly longer left/right earbud cable is completely normal and if you don't believe me, watch a YouTube review on them. If you want a good song to test the bass, look up: "bounce it bass boosted" and click the first result.
customer_reviews.author: TonyVenezia

customer_reviews.title: A broke audiophile's wet dream
customer_reviews.text: I've had these earbuds for over two years and they're still as loud and satisfying as the day I got them. Working in a loud kitchen, my managers have had to take these away from me because I was washing dishes, facing a wall with these in. They couldn't get my attention no matter how loud they shouted my name. I've accidentally put these through the washer machine, I assume a culmination of German engineering and the neat leather pouch that comes with saved them. You will not miss this $30. You will however become addicted to these buds in your ears.
customer_reviews.author: Parker

customer_reviews.title: and the rubber cord isn't as easy to handle as it grips everything (and itself) unlike ...
customer_reviews.text: The audio quality on these doesn't compare at all to the cheaper Sennheiser MX 365 earbuds. I have bought numerous pairs of MX 365's and thought I would try these out because I've never used the in-ear type earbuds before, and these were double the price so I thought it would be well spent. The audio quality on these is not as clear, and the rubber cord isn't as easy to handle as it grips everything (and itself) unlike the rubber used on the MX 365's.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Hearing is believing
customer_reviews.text: What if I told you that I bought Sennheiser Bluetooth headphones and then picked these up too and found out that these are almost just as good as the much more expensive model. Hearing is believing. I actually wear them often. Nice sound quality. Comfortable and great at this price. I recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: D,.L  Smith

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from "Enhanced Bass"!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of Senheiser 400s that I lost, so I got these to replace them. The difference in sound quality is astounding. The "Enhanced Bass" should be a code word for "will drag your music through the mud." The sound quality is similar to wrapping your head in 4 or 5 layers of velvet and putting on a pair of headphones. "Enhanced bass" but weak, muddy treble, and mediocre midrange. I use a pair of Grado SR80s at home. The old Sennheiser 400's were reasonable for trips, these are going to make me cringe every time I throw them in my bag.
customer_reviews.author: Neil D

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Broke after 4 months. Did not last longer than the $5 pair. The 2 yr warranty seems great but not a lot of info and hard to contact anyone regarding replacement - kept mentioning "repair" which is not acceptable for this particular item. Amazon however, was fantastic and replaced them. Hopefully new pair will last longer. I will update stars if they do!
customer_reviews.author: EPH

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not for me.
customer_reviews.text: I don't personally like these AT ALL. My husband says they are good clear quality, but I am used to listening to my music on the apple headphones. I wanted to know what a decent pair of headphones sounded like so I tried these since Sennheiser is reputable and known for good headphones but I HATED Them. All of the bass was ripped out even though they are literally called ENHANCED BASS! If you don't need bass, you'll probably love them, but to me, they sounded flat, airy, and bad. Unfortunately I feel like headphones are all opinion based though so you'd just have to try them for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: K. Harkness

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the size and price. Will work with motorcycle helmets.
customer_reviews.text: I Love the sound of this little headphones. The sound quite rich for their size. I combined them with radian silicone earplugs for a custom fit to my ears and they work perfectly. Once in place that block out the outside noise and they are very flush with your ear, so they work great with a motorcycle full face helmet. One of the headphones cable is longer than the other and this works really well. I was surprised by the sound quality and size of these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto Zilberberg

customer_reviews.title: Wires between earbud are different length.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound. Noise isolating. I have no complaints after using these earbud for several years, mainly while walking or running, but the different cable lengths between the earbuds (the left wire is much shorter than the right wire) is extremely irritating. I have tried various ways to work around this, but the wires always slip back to their default lengths. If you can work with the different wires lengths, you will enjoy the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really nice sounding for cheap headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are quite good for the price, especially when they are on sale. I think these might be the best cheap earbuds available. That being said, I know these are an older generation and I haven't tried the newer comparable Sennheiser models.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Jones

customer_reviews.title: Solid build quality, good audio quality, great budget product.
customer_reviews.text: I needed an inexpensive higher audio quality solution for my teenage daughter to replace her crappy Apple earbuds. My daughter uses these earbuds daily on the bus, at school, and at home. There is no sign of wear on the product and the audio quality is far better than similarly priced options. Do not confuse these earbuds as an equall to the traditional Sennheiser audio options that cost hundreds more. If you want that audio experience you will ha e to pay for it. If you are looking for a great sounding well built set of earbuds I would recommend these a great option.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Mosel

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser makes great sounding earphones
customer_reviews.text: The sound is better than most earphones, probably because of the driver Sennheiser uses. They sound great, good bass.
customer_reviews.author: Julian B.

customer_reviews.title: $30 for buds worth $5
customer_reviews.text: I was incredibly disappointed in the quality of these headphones, I was expecting something more from a pair of Sennheiser's. The bass is good but the mid's and trebels vary from weak to terrible, this is especially apparent when listening to vocals and higher pitched sounds. They sound like something you would expect from a pair of $5 earbuds you see in the checkout lanes of Walmart and other big box stores, your basically just paying for the brand at this point with these. Save your money and buy a pair of Skullcandy earbuds instead.
customer_reviews.author: Ben McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: Return customer
customer_reviews.text: I have had this brand of headphones for many years. This is probably my 3 or 4th pair. I am always pleased with the sound quality of their haedphones. I also prefer their variety of earpiece sizes. I have small ears and I have a hard time keeping other brand buds in.
customer_reviews.author: JNelson

customer_reviews.title: Try em out.
customer_reviews.text: Minimal set of earbuds with true, great sound. Listen to your iPhone headphones and then listed to these. You should appreciate the true sound that these create. Some of you don't know why one side of the earbuds has an adjoining wire that is longer than the other side. I was not expecting this myself, but I prefer this. For those that are confused this has many applications, but I like it because it reduces the wiring as a whole from getting in the way of what you're doing. Just use it for awhile and you will know what I mean. If you really don't like this style then don't buy these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Nope

customer_reviews.title: These are among the best earbuds I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I laugh every time I see someone wearing Beats headphones. Congratulations, you spent far more money for a far inferior product. These are among the best earbuds I've ever used, period. They sound isolate, so when the bud seals your ear canal you get low lows and high highs. I only bought these because I needed a similar pair to the ones I bought years ago for home, office, and travel. These do sound better than the old pair, but only if you really strain yourself to hear the difference. One of those things you use almost every day so do yourself a favor and get a great pair!
customer_reviews.author: jacksoar

customer_reviews.title: Like deep bass and a trusted brand?
customer_reviews.text: I've owned these since October 29, 2014 and they are still going strong. I like to listen to deep bass heavy music and these are perfect for that. I've owned a lot of cheaper headphones like the current #1 panasonics ($8), apple earpods ($15) and the older sony earbuds ($12). Those sounds good enough on their own and I don't mind sweating at the gym with with but my trusty sennys are worth the extra cost.
customer_reviews.author: Robatron

customer_reviews.title: Great earbuds
customer_reviews.text: One of the best pair of earbuds I've ever owned. Sound quality is great, and the bass is really nice. Very comfortable to wear for long periods of time as well. They're not noise cancelling, but due to the tight fit they do block out sounds.
customer_reviews.author: Andrei

customer_reviews.title: Best budget earbuds, wires go down one side on purpose.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best value in headphones out there. I loved my set. Lost them. Got another. Fell asleep wearing them and my idiot cat chewed the wires off. Now, about the idiots claiming something is wrong with the wire lengths...they are designed that way ON PURPOSE. I used them at work in a big plant and like the one sided design. The wire can go inside of shirt or jacket, to device in pocket. The device is in a side pocket, thus wire goes down the side...not hanging down the center.
customer_reviews.author: Honeybee

customer_reviews.title: Honestly now..
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy my CX 215's better.. but my wife preferred these over her CX 215's, so there you go. To Sennheiser's credit (which no one seems to disclose -- likely because they're simply unaware of their condition), I have slight hearing loss in my mid-low tones, so earphones/equalizers that will allow me to compensate by filling in the surrounding frequencies that I -can- hear better, as well as upping those that I'm slightly deaf on, is my ideal setup. The CX 215's allow me to do that better than these.. however, my wife, who does not suffer hearing loss at all, again, prefers these. In either case, a good deal from a great company.
customer_reviews.author: The Nobody

customer_reviews.title: very very good earbuds, well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: These are the real deal, very very good earbuds, well worth the price. These are in fact the second version of the original Sennheiser CX300's also sold by Creative as the Creative EP-630. This particular vendor is selling the real thing. This is important because the Creative-EP-630's had been bootlegged by the chinese years ago. and the market is flooded with Fake Creative EP 630's. the only way you can find out is upon using them and discovering the utter terrible sound quality. The problem remained so bad that Sennheiser being bootlegged themselves has to redesign their earbuds as the ones you see here. more on the Sennheiser CX300 / Creative EP630 bootlegs [...]
customer_reviews.author: Ahkeith Salley

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre performers
customer_reviews.text: These Sennheiser CX 300 II Earbuds are disappointing in several respects: (1) muffled bass--the bass is boomy and poorly defined, (2) very underemphasized mids/highs--vocals sound very far away and lack clarity. Informing the foregoing comments is my experience with (1) circumaural headphones--Panasonic RP-HTX7, which retails for just around $20 and a pair of well-regarded Sennheiser HD595, (2) Samsung earbuds pre-packaged with a Galaxy phone. Even the free samsung earbuds seem to have greater audio fidelity, although their low-end is wanting. In sum, these earbuds are good exercise headphones because they isolate noise adequately, but their performance audio-wise is simply mediocre. This conclusion is largely consonant the impressions of this headphone on such online fora as Head-fi and Audioholics.
customer_reviews.author: D.P.

customer_reviews.title: My third set
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through several sets of these wired earbuds. One set went through the washing machine and still worked. I lost the last set, so this is a replacement. These are not advertised or sold as noice cancelling, but I use them everywhere my wireless earbuds are impractical. I will buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Although the noise-blocking is nice, there are a few problems with the earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Although the noise-blocking is nice, there are a few problems with the earbuds: -These are much more than what I expected asymmetrical to be. The right side is double the left. -The volume is wayyy to loud. I normally listen to music at 1 down from the middle tick on my iPhone (with other earbuds) but with these I’m only at 2 tics of volume (second lowest) and they’re “normal” volume. They’re not great, but they’re not bad either.
customer_reviews.author: the buyers

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in May 2014. They're very comfortable and I think the sound quality is very good. Two days before the two year warranty expired, the right one stopped working. I contacted the company on their website, printed the pre-paid UPS label they gave me and sent them in. A couple of weeks later they sent me a brand new pair. The only complaint I have is that they didn't communicate about the status of my return. But I can live with that. This is that kind of company I like to do business with. Good product. Very good customer service.
customer_reviews.author: E. M. Young

customer_reviews.title: Gym use
customer_reviews.text: This is a post-use review, and these earbuds have long ago bit the dust. I'm a pretty big fan of sennheiser and have been buying their cheaper earbuds for gym use, why sacrifice quality when you can be a little more careful and avoid the gimmicky 'sports' earbuds? Well that's exactly what i did, at $30~ these headphones are easily affordable so long as it's under 1x a year, given that these were not intended for gym use, you won't be surprised to learn they only lasted 1 year. However, due to the extra harsh nature of my use of these headphones, i've not filed a warranty claim as they met and surpassed my expectations for budget earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Roland

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great quality
customer_reviews.text: The box was a little damaged but the earphones were totally safe. I usually like getting these earphones because they sit well in my ears and have great sound quality! They never have disappointed me and have lasted a good while. I don't mind buying them again and again because of the price and how well they work.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Amazing headphones, but not durable
customer_reviews.text: I have had owned 3 of these headphones and after one got destroyed, one was stolen and the other one was lost, I decided to go for it and buy another one. These are earbuds for an audiophile. For someone who feels the mid and low lines. Doesn't distort the sound in any way, and feels really good in your ears. The only bad thing, which is completely understandable due to weight issues, is the quality of cable. If you pull the cable, there's a chance that it won't work in one of the ears. Also, has really good filtering if you are not listening to really high sounds like Dubstep, or similar genres. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Aidin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing !!!
customer_reviews.text: I read an article on these ear buds and the article highly recommended them. I really didn't know what to expect but for the price I figured why not. I had received a gift for Christmas, which were a pair of Beats soloHD headphones, which are great but have their limitations because of the size. I needed a pair of earbuds for when I'm out walking or tooling around the house. The reason I mention the Beats brand is because these earbuds sound just as good, at a fraction of the price. If your wondering about the sound quality of these earbuds wonder no more, these are the real deal. I'm very impressed
customer_reviews.author: TH

customer_reviews.title: Exceed Expectations
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! I didn't want to spend a lot, but did some research and took a chance on these. I must say they far exceeded my expectations. I don't have the greatest or most discriminating hearing anymore (64 y/o), and have always been dissatisfied with ear buds, but don't like over the ear phones when commuting and running around. But these hit the spot! I listen to everything from country music to U2, Led Zepplin, Pink Floyd, John Prine, even some classical. Wonderful rich sound without the hollow sound most cheap earbuds give. Comfortable too. Am considering buying a few pairs for stocking stuffers for my kids!
customer_reviews.author: Domino72

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality for this price. I initially was a little disappointed by the design of having one ear bud's cord longer than the other, but after using it the proper way (the longer cord is supposed to go around the back of your neck), I started to appreciate this design. It keeps the cord off to the side rather than dangling on your chest, and it can be removed more easily when necessary. These ear buds deliver a very clean sound along with decent bass for something that is not a headphone.
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphones, but DO NOT order from Pro W1
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones and have ordered them several times in the past. HOWEVER, I ordered these from the seller "Pro W1" a week ago. I got them in the mail and when I opened them immediately noticed something wrong with them. Opened them up and they are not at all what I have had in the past. They were so blatantly counterfeit. Both earbud strands were even, when they should be separate lengths. I'm glad I know my headphones. Do not order from Pro W1. Save yourself the hassle and the headache.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Sound Good but Poor Build Quality
customer_reviews.text: They sound good, I definitely don't hear the extra bass. You can see and feel they are made extremely cheap, I can see the wire that connects into the bud is not reinforced or protected at all so I bet you these will no last more then a month without something breaking or tearing. I use earbuds daily so I should of got something built a bit better.
customer_reviews.author: my335itt

customer_reviews.title: Good Sound Quality, Short Window for Usability
customer_reviews.text: Really good earbuds, the sound quality is the best I have heard and it rests comfortably in your ears. I really want to recommend this product, but I can't due to it's fragility. The earbuds I purchased stopped playing audio in one ear 1 month after purchase and fully stopped playing any audio 3 months after purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only if you REALLY love bass, possibly to the exclusion of the rest of the music.
customer_reviews.text: The sound is ok, but, as the product states, the bass is extremely enhanced. I listen mostly to jazz. I would describe what I hear with these earbuds as (rather than "enhanced") a quite loud bass "distraction", and possibly even a "diminishment" of other sound qualities. The earbuds seem to be decently constructed although value of the "asymmetrical" design escapes me. Perhaps the utility of this feature would be more obvious if the short side were not so very short, a mere 8 inches. The long side is 20 inches. Three stars seems a bit generous, still, all the info is in the product description. No missing or misleading information here.......
customer_reviews.author: SY

customer_reviews.title: Good product from a trusted brand
customer_reviews.text: The bass is good nothing compared to my car, sennheiser hd598 openback, or my room audio setup that is running on my used and abused denon avr 1910. But for 30$ i would definitely recommend this. I have had them for just over two months and haven't yet had a problem other than no mic/remote. Which actually a problem for me since I have to whip out my phone everytime i want to change a song. The pros definitely outweigh the cons and cost of these really affordable earbuds. I am an sudo audiophile so when I find something I like i usually pass it on to the next person.
customer_reviews.author: Caden realini

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the budget
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought this pair and also a pair of senheiser CX1.00 and definetly it is worth to pay for these CX300. Precision is a good nickname for these buds. The clarity is much superior than the CX1.00, and you can listen to the bass lines properly. The bass can be a little overwhelming for critical listeners (my opinion in the first day, not anymore), but the sound quality overcome this "issue". I can see that some people had problems with the plug, but It is a really confortable plug to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Goncalves de Castro Ferreira

customer_reviews.title: these iem's are the best you can get in this price range -  edit: not durable.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an audiophile. In my opinion, these iem's are the best you can get in this price range. They are very light. If you get a good seal, they have plenty of bass. I also owned the AKG Q701's and some Senn HD518. I compared them to the entry level shure 2 series iem's and I thought the shure's were too heavy (in comparison). Edit: Feb '16 The headphone jack connection is faulty. I should have mailed it in for warranty but I thought I could just splice the wires with another headphone jack to save myself the hassle. The wires are way too small to fix.
customer_reviews.author: yakapo

customer_reviews.title: Noise isolation is not perfect, sound quality is just fine
customer_reviews.text: I use the large ear adapters. I was still able to hear someone talking loudly on the phone in the next room, while I was listening to two people talking over calming music. I have owned these for less than a day, so time will only tell for the durability of these buds. I plan to only use these indoors and use the SoundMAGIC E10 Noise Isolating In-Ear Earphones when I go out. Sound quality is similar between these two, decent. Of course, at this price point, it is unrealistic to expect absolutely incredible, top-of-the-line sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: SHOCKED ME INSIDE MY EARS
customer_reviews.text: I loved these until today. I know they don't sell these anymore, but I feel obligated to tell you that they shorted out IN MY HEAD. Have you ever been shocked inside both ears at the same time? No? WELL, IT'S NOT A GOOD FEELING.
customer_reviews.author: J. G

customer_reviews.title: Tough earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I have used these earbuds for the last three years in variety of environments e.g. laptop, mowing, construction/remodeling, polishing vehicles,etc. Granted my hearing isn't exactly perfect from too many years of loud music and operating farm/industrial equipment without ear protection 30 years ago. Pros: -Very durable -The offset cord design & length helps to prevent the earbuds being pulled out when you are stretching/bending -Offer a basic level of sound isolation. I typically use ear muffs over them if working/operating equipment. -Good voice clarity -Good mid & highs -Good bass Cons/areas for improvement: -Sound isolation Considering these earbuds are under $35, they provide great performance and durability. If your looking for heavy bass these might not be for you.
customer_reviews.author: David276

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I grew skeptical when I saw reviews regarding the asymmetrical cord length. I looked up the headphones on Sennheiser's website and found this information. (Copy and pasted from website.) **Important wearing note! The longer side of the asymetrical cable goes behind the neck and into the opposite ear. This mimics a single sided cable and reduces the amount of cable in front of the wearer during physical activity. This is a safety and ergonomic feature. Please contact Sennheiser with any questions about product fit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Cost -Decent sound Cons: - When the wire is jolted there is some crackling and popping which is pretty painful to the ears. - Not very stable in the ear. Overall: - I would recommend going with the Klipsch IMAGE S4... They are all around better (better sound, more stable in the ear, no popping)... I would strongly discourage anyone looking for a set of headphones for running or for the gym from buying these.
customer_reviews.author: Ian A Jones

customer_reviews.title: As far as earbuds go, they are fine..
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to really write home about. They are good earbuds, but probably not the best. I can still hear nearby conversation if the music isn't loud enough. Bass is non-existent unless if really cram them into my earhole. For what I use them for though, they are good!
customer_reviews.author: Mike L

customer_reviews.title: Not too expensive for excellent sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality of these headphones are honestly better than the $200 headphones. My only problem is my pair only lasted about a year before one side stopped working, but the warranty allowed me to get new ones completely free. Get the warranty; it's cheap and useful.
customer_reviews.author: Rani

customer_reviews.title: The Sony CX300II VS The Sony XB850AP Extra Bass?
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pair of earbuds. Loud ass hell, Bass is there for sure and highs could be overwhelming at times, which can over power the bass at times. Not as Boomy, rock your ear off bass like the Sony but it can be due to its brightness compared to Sony. All in all to me its worth it at half the price of the Sony Extra bass earbuds cant go wrong with the Sennheiser. If you do have a few extra bucks get the Sony though Where the highs aren't overpowered and you can enjoy more of the bass effect.
customer_reviews.author: Papichulo

customer_reviews.title: They work hard until they die
customer_reviews.text: Provided great sound and sound isolation for a pair of ear buds. Handy carrying case. Mine lost sound in one ear after about a year of gym use, including accidentally yanking them out of my ears dozens of times with weights. They got wet a few times and still worked flawlessly. I don't like how one ear bud's wire is shorter than the other, it was awkward to one-ear short conversations in the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not work out headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones were great until they broke after 1 year of wearing them. I will admit that I used them to work out and run with, but the left headphone broke and stopped working. The bass in these are very good, so if you don't plan to use them for working out or moving around a lot, then they're probably a good choice. As for me, the price was not worth it for how long they lasted. I've had cheaper headphones last longer than this when I used them to work out with.
customer_reviews.author: David Reil

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I cycle through different earbuds for biking/walking around outside of my home, but I keep returning to these. I haven't found another pair at this price point with comparable audio fidelity. The bass response is lack luster, and the "clear-ness" of the audio won't blow you away, but if you are using skullcandy earbuds, or the earbuds that came with your smartphone for free, you will notice a difference.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Died 36 days after purchase
customer_reviews.text: The right earbud died a month after purchasing the product, they sounded great for $30 but i cant recommend a product that stops working only a month after purchase, sennheisers a great brand and they make high quality products its a shame to see something like this fail so soon.
customer_reviews.author: Deann C.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after three months :/
customer_reviews.text: I personally like the sound, I’ve been learning about sound design and engineering for about 2 years so I like to think I’m developing my ear for these kinds of things (I’m otherwise a professional DJ by trade) but, one side stopped working a little 3 months. Lame
customer_reviews.author: A. Ella

customer_reviews.title: and some reviews online and decided for $30 they probably weren't so bad. The sound is really mediocre
customer_reviews.text: Keep shopping: I read a review on consumer reports, and some reviews online and decided for $30 they probably weren't so bad. The sound is really mediocre. Not horrible, but a long way from something you should brag about. And something I failed to pick up from the pictures or review, but is annoying to me, is that the cord to the left ear bud is almost a full foot shorter than the one going to the right ear. Good headphones to leave on your desk at work, but if you're looking for great sound...keep shopping.
customer_reviews.author: TMS

customer_reviews.title: They broke after only 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: I loved these earphones, the sound quality is pretty nice and the bass isn't too bad. But sadly, I purchased these in March 2019, and now, in September 2019, the Right earbud is shorting out and not working. These earphones never leave the house and I've treated them well. Can't believe they broke in 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Billy / Heather

customer_reviews.title: One side is meant to be longer then the other....
customer_reviews.text: Ok.... People please stop giving these headphones bad reviews. One side is SUPPOSED to be longer then the other. These headphones are asymmetrical, meaning the cord hangs from the side not the middle. The cord goes straight down from your left ear and around the back of your head to your right ear. As far as sound goes these have great overall sound with emphasis on the bass.
customer_reviews.author: daniel esquivias

customer_reviews.title: Very unique design,,,,,,,,
customer_reviews.text: I have lots of issues and have to listen to the TV or my tunes through headphones or buds. Of late my lymphedema has made it painful to use headphones so I was searching for something to replace my Sennheiser wireless headphones. I chose these and was pleasantly surprised because the sound was great but the design is even better. I always had to look to see which one was "L" or "R" and their fix is unique - the lead to the left bud is shorter than the right so you can grab and plug. Why someone else hasn't thought of this I will never know but i am very happy with these buds.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, bad wires
customer_reviews.text: I've always been happy with Sennheiser sound quality. Definitely better than your average set of earbuds. The wires they attach to these earbuds are not so great. I had them for maybe a year before the right one stopped working. Not doing anything especially crazy with them either.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Brodginski

customer_reviews.title: Best Earbuds I've Ever Had!
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds are by far the best earbuds I've ever used. Having ordered them more than a year and a half ago, and having accidentally gone through the laundry once, they somehow still sound like they are brand new. I listen to my music at a medium to slightly loud volume and I've never noticed any problems with the sound. In fact, the sound is better than any other earbuds I've used. The overall balance is great and the balance between treble and bass is just right.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best ear buds I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I read the wires don't easily tangle, and while they do tangle a bit from time to time, they never tangle as badly as the stock iPhone or other ear buds do. The sound quality is excellent, and the carrying pouch is simple and easy to store. I have owned these for over two years and still love them. I'm now buying a pair for my daughter since she needs a good pair that don't easily tangle and are less likely to get lost since they have a nice carrying pouch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: All Kinds of Awesome
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are awesome! A much thicker, very noticeable bass sound coming from these earbuds especially in comparison to my old Sony earbuds. My new 37 dollar earbuds out perform my 150 dollar, over the ear Bose headphones. The difference is rather noticable. Shame on you Bose. The goofy cable seemed so stupid at first, I was pretty upset. But then I gave it a chance and I really learned to like the cable. I was eating lunch the other day while listening to my old headphones and the cable was getting caught in my fork. That will not happen with these because of the goofy cable! I am totally impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole Segura

customer_reviews.title: Best inexpensive headphone I own.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many brands/models of headphone in the les-expensive category, and these are way between than most anything else. I'm sad to see they are discontinuing them, but I hope they are replaced with something equivalent.
customer_reviews.author: PsYcLeMaNiA

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser Forever.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Sennheisers and I am never disappointed by the sound quality or the life span of my headphones! I bought my first pair in 2009 and they lasted until this year when I accidentally pulled one of the wires out of the earbud, This is really the only brand I prefer to use. They are incredibly comfortable in the ear, and come with three sizes of sleeve for a perfect fit. The bass quality and voice quality is excellent. I listen to a lot of audio books and vocals are crystal clear. I'm a life-long fan!
customer_reviews.author: WordFloe

customer_reviews.title: Decent headphones
customer_reviews.text: When something says "Enhanced Bass", you expect it to have good bass. This is the exact opposite. No matter what device I use these with, there is a distinct lack of bass. I'm not sure how I could be doing something wrong, they fit wonderfully and I love the full size headphones by Sennheiser, I guess I'm just expecting too much. Edit: it appears to be a problem in how I was wearing them. Slightly adjusting the position so they point higher in the ear made a tremendous difference. There is still the problem of cable noise on my Galaxy S4, but it isn't noticeable when used with my iPod or any of my computers.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Hardman

customer_reviews.title: Tiny with good sound quality - thats exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I bought this same headset - I use it during night to listen to ambient sleep music that drowns out other sounds (snoring/etc) and helps me sleep. The twisting and turning finally got the better of the wires and hence the replacement. These headphones are one of the lowest profiles and fits in the ears nicely without jutting out and pressing against the ears even when I am sleeping on my side with my head on a pillow. The old ones are still working except for the wire that has broken from inside due to the kind of usage they underwent :)
customer_reviews.author: Rajiv

customer_reviews.title: I've owned these for over 5 years and have no complaints
customer_reviews.text: You cannot beat the quality of sound, material, and durability for the price. Like I already mentioned I have owned these earbuds for over 5 years and they still sound great and not worn or beaten up, the sound is also very good.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Pretty flat frequency response
customer_reviews.text: Pretty flat frequency response, slightly nicer than Panasonic ErgoFits (much better when listening to Bach, but less difference noticeable when listening to classic rock). Not a match for Sennheiser HD 598s Sony MDR 7506s (Or even the similarly priced Koss PortaPro), but a decent earbud for a decent price nonetheless. The medium sized eartips are a bit too big, but the small ones just about do the trick (I wish there was an in between, however).
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Scanteianu

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I had some bose earbuds that lasted about 5 years and finally broke. I replaced them with these with little expectation and wow was I wrong. They are crystal clear and have amazing mids and highs just like bose, but even more very good bass! Buy these for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones for sitting alone and studying
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones for sitting alone and studying. I feel that the just didn't block out enough noise for me. If I decide to study in a noisy cafeteria these headphones do not do an adequate enough job at keeping the noise out. The sound quality is very good and so I love to use them when I am alone or in a somewhat quiet environment. I had originally bought them to wear while riding my motorcycle, but I found that they just don't block out enough sound for me on the highway. I went with theand like them better when riding and around noise.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: But these cx 300 II headphones are amazing. They fit almost too good
customer_reviews.text: So, i have had these in ear headphones for a couple of weeks. I am a big fan of the larger over the ear sennheiser headphones and i was skeptical about having in ear headphones. But these cx 300 II headphones are amazing. They fit almost too good. The range of these small speakers is impressive, they have a very powerful low end compared to other in ear headphones and the clarity is great. Although the cord length for each ear is a different size (i guess this is common with other headphones ) and it is taking time to get used to. The sound quality and fit make these an easy 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Chisholm

customer_reviews.title: Good Earbuds for the Price
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality for these earbuds is only average, but I think that's fine for the price point. One thing about these that can get a bit annoying sometimes is that where the wire splits for each earbud, one side is far longer than the other.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clear, Detailed, Precise, with lots of Bass
customer_reviews.text: These things sound great, especially when you consider the price. Great value. Plenty of low frequency thump, yet they still sound very clear and precise, due to having plenty of high and mid-high frequency output. Basically, you hear all the detail you could want to hear. I have a set of Skullcandy Titan earbuds, similarly priced, with a larger driver, and they put out a little more bass, but they sound a lot muddier, because they have little in the way of high frequency output. By the way, don't buy bass enhanced earbuds for use with a headphone amp on an electric bass guitar. Totally unnecessary.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL D PEARCE

customer_reviews.title: The pair I got adds clearly audible noise to the ...
customer_reviews.text: The pair I got adds clearly audible noise to the signal. I hear the noise click on and off as the units starts and stops receiving a signal. I'm also not crazy about the asymmetric design, but maybe that's convenient for some people somehow. This might be the most negative review I've ever posted -- the pair I got are just barely tolerable due to the noise.
customer_reviews.author: Andy P

customer_reviews.title: Best value in ear earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I am a religious Shure user, so when my set had to go in for warranty work, I bought the Sennheiser CX 300IIs to hold me over. I am the type to do 2 days of research before I buy anything, these get great reviews-- and they deserve it. Mids are decent and lows are very "solid" for this price point. Highs aren't too shabby either. They fit great, the "athletic" setup takes a little bit to get used to, but it works well. I use my headphones everyday, these worked great for me. If you are using cheap earbuds or, god forbid, the free earbuds that came with your device, order these immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Vinh Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Quality and VERY comfortable earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I stumbled across these Sennheiser earbuds a few years ago as a 5 dollar Black Friday deal and they've become my favorite ever. I find these incredibly comfortable for long wear on a flight, with excellent quality sound. You can imagine how devastated I was when I lost them in an airport... but found these to replace my lost buds. They come with a great little leather pouch to store them in, I picked up a small rubber headset smart wrap which keeps the wire nicely untangled and fits perfectly in the pouch. Great, and affordable... loved them so much I picked up a set for my husband and son!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Greenleaf

customer_reviews.title: Excellent earbuds. For the time that it worked
customer_reviews.text: Excellent earbuds. For the time that it worked, I was completely in love. Since I do use earbuds more than most people would, it broke pretty fast for me - but then again I realize it's mainly my fault because I didn't take the best care of these earbuds. If you're looking for something reasonably priced and has clear audio, so on. This is definitely the way to go. I didn't think I would be able to hear a difference between my regular Apple earbuds or this, but now switching between them, there's more of a clear difference.Be wary if you buy it from a third party though! I'll probably return to this set of earbuds when I can.
customer_reviews.author: Helen Shi

customer_reviews.title: Expected so much more from Sennheiser
customer_reviews.text: Totally bizarre, one earpiece is on a 6" cord and the other about 18". Sound isn't as good as the Samsung ear buds. Zero bass. So disappointed, not worth 10 bucks in opinion. The one positive is the plug, it's very heavy duty.in fact the best I've ever seen in thus type of headphone.
customer_reviews.author: Konamonster

customer_reviews.title: Really high sound quality/price ratio
customer_reviews.text: Besides my audiophile stereo system, I have a number of audiophile headphones–both in-ear and over-the-ear. These certainly aren't audiophile quality but they're sure really nice for certain situations like my iTouch or my bedside radio, neither of which can put out audiophile sound quality anyway, when I can't sleep at night and don't want to disturb my wife's sleep. For many people, the sound quality would be perfectly suitable and at this price, wow! I bought a bunch of them to put on all our computers and mobile devices.
customer_reviews.author: MikeMac

customer_reviews.title: cheap
customer_reviews.text: These headphones right out of the box feel extremely cheap And look like you could get them on a clearance isle at the dollar store. Another major issue is that one headphone wire is extremely shorter than the other, making the headphones look like they were cut off And re attached 3-5 inches shorter than the other headphone. Another issue is that the headphones are very small And are hard to put in your ear. However, the sound of the headphones are good And the bass is great. The price was cut down 7% after a while And the package arrived 4 days earlier than expected. I wouldn't recommend these, unless you need headphones ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value, and Excellent Sound
customer_reviews.text: I have never auditioned one of those $150+ a pair earbuds, because I am never going to spend that kind of money for something I wear to the gym. I have auditioned plenty of $30 pairs, and I can say that these are absolutely the best sounding buds I have found for this kind of money. The sound they produce is well balanced. Crisp, clean highs, and just enough bass. I listen to a lot of different kinds of music, but not rap. For those who do, these will not kill brain cells with each electronic drum beat. But for everyone else, you should find these ear buds pretty exceptional. I'm thinking of ordering a second pair, just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Opey

product_meta.title: Sennheiser CX300 II CX 300 II Precision Enhanced Bass Earbuds, Black (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Offering a powerful, bass driven stereo sound with greater clarity and improved dynamics over standard earbuds are the Sennheiser CX 300 II in ear headphones. The various sizes of ear adapters (S/M/L sizes) provided in the package allow for a customized fit as well as exceptional noise blocking capability. A convenient carrying pouch is also included for easy storage.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 Sennheiser CX 300-II 

Offering a powerful, bass-driven stereo sound with greater clarity and improved dynamics over standard earbuds are the CX 300-II ear-canal phones. The various sizes of ear adapters (S/M/L sizes) provided in the package allow for a customized fit as well as exceptional noise blocking capability.

 * High passive noise attenuation 
 * Modern, bass-driven stereo sound 
 * Built-tough with a 2 YEAR warranty! 

Learn more about the CX 300-II The CX 300-II features an asymetrical cable which the longer end goes behind the neck and into the opposite ear. This mimics a single sided cable and reduces the amount of cable in front of the wearer during physical activity. This is a safety and ergonomic feature.



Features  * High-quality dynamic speaker systems for bass-driven stereo sound and durability 
 * Personalized fit in the ear canals functions as an earplug and high-quality speaker 
 * Customizable ear adapter system achieves the perfect fit 
 * Convenient carrying pouch included 
   
 *  Asymmetrical cable reduces tangles and cable clutter 
 * Built-tough with a 2 Year warranty 

Did you know? The CX 300-II is available in black or silver. 


Sennheiser recommends this headset for... ... those looking to upgrade from standard ear-buds, and those that crave great sound in a compact, portable package.

Compatibility The CX 300-II is Compatible (listen only) with latest generation of tablets and 1/8" jack smartphones and portable music players.

Warranty The CX 300-II is covered by a 2-year global warranty. Sennheisr's worldwide network can quickly and reliably handle any warranty issues. 

Technical Data Frequency response 19-21,000 Hz Impedance 16 ohms Sound pressure level (SPL) 113 dB (1kHz/1Vrms) Transducer principle Dynamic Cable length 3.9 ft. (1.2 m) Jack plug 1/8 (3.5 mm) Warranty 2 Years Why Sennheiser ? For over 60 years every Sennheiser mic or headphone comes with a built-in mission: to stay true to the sound and soul the music was given by its artist. From the fragile intimacy of a whispered word to the deep and dark punch of an attacking bassline. Sennheiser delivers pure emotion and excitement. A quality that has convinced a broad spectrum of artists and of course music lovers all over the world. Sennheiser offers a great experience for everyone who really wants to hear. 

What's in the box?  * CX 300-II ear-canal phones 
 * Ear adapter set (S/M/L) 
 * Carrying pouch
feature_bullets: Optimised for MP3, iPod, iPhone, CD players and portable gaming systems
Dynamic transducers deliver powerful, bass driven sound
16 ohm impedance is ideal for use with cell phones, tablets and portable music players
In ear canal design provides ambient noise isolation to improve listening experience
1.2 meter asymmetrical cable with 3.5 millimeter right angled plug;the longer end goes behind the neck and into the opposite ear
Soft silicon ear tips (Small, Medium, and Large size included) to optimize fit for comfort and sound quality

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars10,739 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
